Question
========

One tests H~1~: p = 0.7 against H~2~: p = 0.9 in a random sample of n = 8 observations. Testing quantity is the binomially distributed stochast B, the number of successes in the sample. As the right critical limit, the value 6 is used. The discernment power 1 - Î² is then equal to

Answerlist
----------

* 0.94
* 0.96
* 0.98

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.94: Incorrect
* 0.96: Incorrect
* 0.98: Correct
